item.title: üìä About Me
item.description:
I’m Aman, a Data Engineer & Data Scientist, currently pursuing my Master‚Äôs in Data Science at the University of San Francisco (USF).

I specialize in building scalable data pipelines, processing large-scale geospatial datasets, and applying machine learning to real-world data problems.

üõ†Ô∏è Data Engineering #

  • Big Data Pipelines ‚Üí Processing 100+ GB of satellite imagery weekly
  • Cloud & Storage ‚Üí Experience with AWS, GCP, and on-prem data warehouses
  • Geospatial Data Processing ‚Üí Automating geospatial ETL workflows for environmental monitoring
  • ETL Optimization ‚Üí Reduced data latency by 40% through pipeline refactoring

üìà Data Science #

  • Machine Learning for Geospatial Data ‚Üí Applying ML models to detect land use changes
  • Feature Engineering at Scale ‚Üí Building data transformations that power predictive models
  • Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) ‚Üí Extracting insights from multi-terabyte datasets
  • Time Series & Forecasting ‚Üí Predicting trends in satellite imagery & geospatial metrics

‚ö° Current Work #

  • Satellite Data Processing ‚Üí Developing an end-to-end AI-powered geospatial pipeline for The Nature Conservancy
  • Debugging & Optimization at Scale ‚Üí Previously worked on Meta’s data warehouse, improving SQL & ETL performance

üìÑ More About Me #

  • Download My Resume
  • GitHub
  • LinkedIn

I enjoy solving tough data problems, optimizing ML pipelines, and engineering scalable solutions for massive datasets.

item.title: üöÄ Automating Geospatial Data Processing for The Nature Conservancy
item.description:
üåç Scaling Environmental Data Processing with a Custom CLI Tool

In collaboration with The Nature Conservancy (TNC), I developed an end-to-end geospatial data pipeline
to process large-scale satellite imagery used for environmental conservation and land monitoring.

Handling terabytes of satellite data efficiently is challenging‚Äî
so I built a CLI tool that automates data retrieval, preprocessing, and visualization
to help conservationists work with geospatial data at scale.

‚ö° The Problem: Scaling Environmental Data Processing #

Environmental research often relies on geospatial data from sources like NASA, Sentinel, and Landsat.
However, working with large-scale raster imagery presents multiple challenges:
